basics.name: Daniel Plas Rivera
basics.label: Python Full Stack Developer
basics.summary: Over a decade of experience as a Full Stack Web/Application Developer passionate about modern and upcoming technologies. I am addicted to testing out new frameworks and programming languages. I love enabling older applications to work with present day technologies. I enjoy working with front end and back end stacks, even the multiple layers under them.

work.summary: Working providing various consulting services utilizing Python programming language and the infrastructure supporting it
highlights: Stay current with trends and incorporate emerging technologies to benefit the client.
Build REST APIs to match client specs provided to deliver needed functionality.
Build Proof Of Concepts for clients
Review road maps and provide time frames for projects
Build tech stack requirements for clients

Stack: Docker, Python2, Python3, Django, Flask, Celery, SQLAlchemy, Sqlite, Oracle, Postgres, MongoDB, Javascript, React, Jenkins, Artifactory, Splunk, New Relic, Git, Microsoft Azure, AWS, Terraform, Packer
Stack: Python3, Django

work.summary: Risk Rating needed to move away from vendor locked solution. I discussed with the team how to create a new platform featuring aspects of its predecessor. I reviewed our ideas and brought them to fruition by developing initial POC’s proving technologies. I broke epics into stories for the team. I provided code reviews, developed several micro services including but not limited to running data models for computing lenders “Probability of default”. I also put in extra effort to ensure dockerization of services. I offered highly detailed documentation per micro service and python package. Results ended up being a dockerized microservices with clear documentation provided.
highlights: Stack: Python, flask, sqlalchemy, oracle, postgres, jenkins, docker, docker-compose, artifactory

work.position: Sr. Python Full Stack Engineer - Contractor
work.summary: Worked as a Full Stack Python Engineer in Finance & Insurance, with a focus on Docker Container infrastructure, Pipelines in CI/CD and SOA Appliances. Analyze & improve current architecture and Increase performance of services and the platform.
highlights: Made Jenkins groovy scripts to build, upload, and deployment of new docker images to Artifactory on Git PR merges.
Utilized New Relic and Splunk for identifying under performing flows, issues and bottlenecks.
Optimized code to improve performance and scalability.
Documented new and undocumented services.
Stack: Python, django, flask, celery, react, redis, oracle, postgres, mongodb, jenkins, docker, docker-compose, IBM datapower, artifactory, splunk, new relic

work.summary: Took ownership of implementation of VPN technologies into the companies internal tax audit platform. While in charge of setting up VPN Infrastructure on Azure, used Docker and Docker-Compose to have VPN containers launched when initiated by the PaaS. Worked at PwC offices in San Jose, and in San Francisco for this role.
highlights: Debugged React and Django integrations.
Worked on VPN features for our internal tax audit platform, developed frontend, and backend solutions utilizing Django.
Refactored Python applications for SnapLogic data pipelines.
Built vSEC lab environments to mimic possible virtualized security solution configurations.
Stack: Python3, celery, celery beat, redis, sqlite, react, django, docker, docker-compose, VSTS, Azure, ip-sec, vpn, openconnect, Snaplogic, AWS, Checkpoint Vsec, pulse secure

work.summary: Collaborated cross functionally to develop target state cloud architecture and supporting organization model along with the platform roadmap required to achieve that target state. Defined multi-year platform strategy adjusting to new technologies and requirements as they evolve. Drove cloud technology discussions and facilitated decisions with other teams within the organization. Kept abreast of and gained expertise in the evolving technology and understand how new technologies could be applied to Cloud offering.
highlights: Stay current with IAAS & PAAS trends and incorporate emerging technology to benefit the platform.
Research, test and understand the value of a containerized cloud offerings.
Build REST APIs to match specs provided by other teams to deliver needed functionality.
Executes POCs and feasibility studies to validate next-gen product concepts and technologies leveraging results to guide business and technology decisions.
Enforce adherence to architectural standards/principles, global product-specific guidelines, usability design standards, etc.
Work with product owners and other functional teams to translate the road map into releases.
Drive technical designs to consensus and approval.
Stack: Python3, Microsoft Azure, Terraform, Packer, Git, Flask, Flask-RestPlus, MongoDB, TDD, Agile, Kanban, Jenkins

work.summary: Worked on transitioning Columbia University to a Python stack while maintaining compatibility with older technologies, including: 1) creating and implementing a server flow working with older components to make sure nothing breaks 2) recreating improved versions of older applications with the Python stack, and 3) creating middleware for older apps to interact with new technologies.
highlights: Built Full Stack Python Applications for the University.
Wrote Python scripts to parse JSON documents and load the data in database.
Created automated tools from the ground up to transfer from JSON, CSV, TSV, to database daily.
Development locally with Vagrant and Docker for virtualized instances of servers and databases on the fly.
Built REST APIs to serve out data from databases to legacy systems.
Programmatically established levels of authorized access to restrict-allow systems REST API access.
Created automated scripts to make REST api calls with server, parse output report to excel files daily.
Used GIT, JIRA for version control and to handle project issues, workflow and tickets.
Created and planned out the server flow infrastructure for python web app stack for Columbia University.
Follows Agile SDLC, made sure code is always up to PEP8 standards, and servers (with code) pass unit & load tests.
Quickly figured out if requirements provided are impossible or not.

Stack: Python3, python2, GIT, Flask/Blueprint, JIRA, Apache 2.2, Mod_WSGI, Oracle(11g,12c), Axure RP, Vagrant, Docker, Jenkins, Virtualbox, Postman, LTI, Oauth1, Oauth2, REST, Sakai, Canvas, Unix Bash/Shell Script, CRON, JavaScript, Nodejs, JSON

work.summary: Based on your location you will be exposed real time to information in real time, based on their location!
highlights: Implement Google Maps for our platform and style it for plotting our data.
Create menu using React.JS for restful api CRUD events for events management and notifications.
Recreating app in React Native with focus on iOS.

work.summary: Educated learners or students who wished to pursue careers in web development or python.
highlights: Mentor students in web development as they work through a project-based curriculum.
Guide students through the challenges of becoming a developer.
Lead weekly one-on-one online student questions/answers sessions to provide feedback on student code and projects.

work.summary: Delivered a dynamic interactive mobile friendly/mobile first revamp of the careers page for individuals to find open positions at all the companies that started at Work-Bench.
highlights: Built a job scraper using the Indeed API to pull all of the companies member/portfolio jobs.
Developed page to let users sort the received api feed and browse by location, job function, category.
Stack: Git, Heroku, Ruby, Middleman Framework, REST, JavaScript, Jslint, JSON, Twitter Bootstrap, SCSS, Media Queries.

work.summary: Delivered an unrivaled online experience that connects to the current POS system for the fast-growing chain of houseware & hardware stores in NYC.
highlights: Developed an e-commerce solution to ensure the company developed as a national online retailer.
On boarded and trained the team for Full stack Web Development and the SEO team.
Worked with Google Online Strategist to revamp ad campaigns, increase sales, and raise our site ranking.
Worked with Google Tag Implementation Team to complete the installation of Dynamic Re-marketing Code and E-Commerce Tracking in Magento for adwords.
Created and managed, and implemented new features for subsidiaries’ e-commerce companies JuicifyMe, LibrettoEspresso, MyEspressoStore.
Stack: Magento, MySQL, SEO, Google Analytics, Google AdWords, PHP, JavaScript, Jquery, GIT, CSS3, HTML5, Photoshop, Photography, Twitter Bootstrap

education.institution: New York City College of Technology

awards.title: Hack NYU Hackathon
awards.summary: MVP Winner. SudoLove connects participants, sponsors and mentors for global hackathons via an app.

awards.title: AngelHack 2016 Manhattan
awards.summary: Winning Grand Prize(Hackcelerator) and Best Use Of Amazon Web Services. New York Minute is your pocket companion app to eliminate the frustration of getting around in New York City. It calculates the fastest, cheapest way to get to the desired destination by comparing the Uber car service and public transportation. Target users are New Yorkers who understand the fast pace of New York City life. Sponsors Technologies used Amazon AWS: Elastic Beanstalk, EBS, EC2, Route 53, S3 Amazon Alexa Esri ArcGIS.

references.name: Latonia Robinson, Dir. of Operations, The K.I.S. Foundation
references.reference: Daniel is an absolute joy to work with and continues to impress us with his technical skill sets. Whenever we have a problem with our website, he always has the answer or recommendations for improvement. Daniel follows direction well, he's always aware of the latest programs or trends, he works well with deadlines, he's able to communicate effectively, he's super reliable, and his experience is absolutely priceless. We're so thankful to have him working with us as part of our team!

references.name: Antonio Riccardi, Web Engineer at Basics Plus
references.reference: Daniel is one of the best developers we know. His speed and ability to conquer any challenge thrown at him helped us recover our online presence. He led our team here through rigorous challenges with unique solutions each time always getting the job done before the deadlines. Working with him was a blast and we would recommend him when it comes to handling tough projects!
